parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Interaction

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Shows or hides the compass on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item. (default [[true]])

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''showCompass''' show

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> show: [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[showCompass]] [[false]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[shownCompass]], [[visibleCompass]], [[showGPS]], [[showRadio]], [[showWatch]], [[showPad]], [[showMap]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 16 Aug, 2009</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Generalcarver|GeneralCarver]]<dd class="note">
In Arma 2, the Compass is now an inventory item. Class path is CfgWeapons->ItemCompass. Use the commands addWeapon and removeWeapon to add or remove it from a unit's inventory. (example: player addweapon "ItemCompass") 


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
